intro: Amerimnon hancei, commonly known as the Hance's spurge, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species known for their milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
